name: FilterableMenuRoot
description:
Groups all parts of the filterable menu.
Doesn't render its own HTML element.

defaultOpen.description:
Whether the popup is initially open.

To render a controlled popup, use the `open` prop instead.

open.description: Whether the popup is currently open.

onOpenChange.type: ((open: boolean, event: Event | undefined, reason: Combobox.RootInternal.OpenChangeReason | undefined) => void)
onOpenChange.description: Event handler called when the popup is opened or closed.
onOpenChange.detailedType:
| ((
    open: boolean,
    event: Event | undefined,
    reason:
      | Combobox.RootInternal.OpenChangeReason
      | undefined,
  ) => void)
| undefined

actionsRef.description:
A ref to imperative actions.
- `unmount`: When specified, the combobox will not be unmounted when closed.
Instead, the `unmount` function must be called to unmount the combobox manually.
Useful when the combobox's animation is controlled by an external library.

autoComplete.description:
Controls how the component behaves with respect to list filtering and inline autocompletion.
- `list` (default): items are dynamically filtered based on the input value. The input value does not change based on the active item.
- `both`: items are dynamically filtered based on the input value, which will temporarily change based on the active item (inline autocompletion).
- `inline`: items are static (not filtered), and the input value will temporarily change based on the active item (inline autocompletion).
- `none`: items are static (not filtered), and the input value will not change based on the active item.

autoHighlight.description: Whether to automatically highlight the first item when the popup opens.

cols.description: The number of columns the items are rendered in grid layout.

defaultInputValue.description: The uncontrolled input value when initially rendered.

filter.type: ((item: Item, query: string, itemToString: ((item: Item) => string) | undefined) => boolean) | null
filter.description:
Filter function used to match items vs input query.
The `itemToString` function is provided to help convert items to strings for comparison.
filter.detailedType:
| ((
    item: Item,
    query: string,
    itemToString: ((item: Item) => string) | undefined,
  ) => boolean)
| null
| undefined

inputValue.description: The input value of the combobox.

items.description:
The items to be displayed in the list.
Can be either a flat array of items or an array of groups with items.

limit.description: The maximum number of items to display in the list.

modal.description:
Determines if the combobox enters a modal state when open.
- `true`: user interaction is limited to the combobox: document page scroll is locked and pointer interactions on outside elements are disabled.
- `false`: user interaction with the rest of the document is allowed.

onInputValueChange.type: ((value: string, event: Event | undefined, reason: string | undefined) => void)
onInputValueChange.description: Callback fired when the input value of the combobox changes.
onInputValueChange.detailedType:
| ((
    value: string,
    event: Event | undefined,
    reason: string | undefined,
  ) => void)
| undefined

onItemHighlighted.type: ((value: Item | undefined, data: { type: 'none' | 'keyboard' | 'pointer', index: number }) => void)
onItemHighlighted.description:
Callback fired when the user navigates the list and highlights an item.
Passes the item and the type of navigation or `undefined` when no item is highlighted.
- `keyboard`: The item was highlighted via keyboard navigation.
- `pointer`: The item was highlighted via pointer navigation.
- `none`: The item was highlighted via programmatic navigation.

onOpenChangeComplete.description: Event handler called after any animations complete when the popup is opened or closed.

onSelectedValueChange.type: ((value: Item, event: Event | undefined, reason: string | undefined) => void)
onSelectedValueChange.description: Callback fired when the selected value of the combobox changes.
onSelectedValueChange.detailedType:
| ((
    value: Item,
    event: Event | undefined,
    reason: string | undefined,
  ) => void)
| undefined

virtualized.description: Whether the combobox items are virtualized.

disabled.description: Whether the component should ignore user interaction.

readOnly.description: Whether the user should be unable to choose a different option from the popup.
